item.title: GameStop Attempting to Break Mario Cosplay Gathering Record
item.content:encoded:
It’s a we, Mario!

March 10 has become Mario Day (Mar 10) for many gamers. This year, a New York City GameStop is to celebrate the day by attempting to break a record for the largest gathering of people dressed as Mario. The current record for the largest gathering of people dressed as Mario is 230 participants. This was set on August 18, 2010, in Chifeng City, Inner Mongolia, China.

It will be an entire Mario-themed event. There will be prizes and many photo ops. The best Mario cosplayer will receive a free Nintendo Switch 2. All who participate will also receive $5 in bonus store credit to use on any item in the store. You’re free to come dressed as Luigi, but you won’t get the store credit.

Qualifications for the costume are simple. All you need is a red shirt, blue overalls, a red hat, and a mustache.

Mario Is Still Celebrating His 40th Anniversary

Through April, with the release of the Super Mario Galaxy Movie, Mario continues to celebrate his 40th anniversary. As part of the anniversary, Nintendo has released Mario Tennis Fever. There’s also an upcoming Yoshi game, Yoshi and the Mysterious Book. However, most are wondering when the next 3D Mario experience will be released.

It has been almost 9 years since Nintendo released Super Mario Odyssey on the original Nintendo Switch. This is easily the longest timeframe between brand-new 3D Mario releases. Nintendo released a port of Super Mario 3D World on the Nintendo Switch, which included a secondary mode in Bowser’s Fury. However, they have not released a full 3D Mario game since 2017.

With the latest Mario movie celebrating the legacy of one of the best-reviewed 3D Mario games of all time, many are dying to get back to the Mushroom Kingdom in a brand new experience. For now, maybe you can go to New York City and dress up like Mario and hope of winning a free Nintendo Switch 2 so that you’ll be ready whenever that new game does come.

RSVP for the gathering here.

Would you participate in an event like this? When do you think the next Mario game will be announced?

item.title: Call of Duty Warzone Adjusts Killstreaks in Season 2 Patch
item.content:encoded:
Raven Software has revealed patch notes for the latest Call of Duty: Warzone Season 2 update. The patch includes an update to Killstreaks in multiple modes and other bug fixes.

Regarding Killstreaks, several updates have been made. They have adjusted the spawn rates of Killstreaks in loot. Resurgence modes have received a 50% reduction from Supply boxes and a 25% reduction from ground loot. This adjustment also counts for Ranked Play. Battle Royale modes have received a 10% reduction in Killstreaks overall.

They’ve also made specific adjustments to Precision Airstrikes, Napalm Strikes, Cluster Strikes, and Bunker Busters. The radius for Killstreak call-ins has gone down to 150 meters. It was originally 255 meters. They’ve also adjusted the limit from three to two. Additionally, they’ve made a change to where only one type of Killstreak is allowed in any given radius.

“Individually, you can deploy one Killstreak of a specific type every 20 seconds. Your squad is limited to one active Killstreak of that type as well. Once used, this allows opponents a window to retaliate. We will continue monitoring Killstreak usage and performance across all modes and make adjustments as needed,” the notes state.

Additional Bug Fixes in the Latest Call of Duty: Warzone Patch

Additional bug fixes include a fix to an issue that prevented players from properly progressing the “Absolute Zero” mastery camo challenge for the NX Ravager. Also, an issue that allowed players to fall through maps in certain areas has been fixed.

How are you enjoying Call of Duty: Warzone? Sound off in our official Discord server. Also, don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: All Pokémon Go Tour: Kalos Timed Research Tasks & Rewards
item.content:encoded:
Pokémon Go Tour: Kalos is underway, and those participating in the event have a heap of rewards available to earn, including some only available for a limited time through Timed Research.

Pokémon‘s sixth generation takes center stage in the latest Pokémon Go Tour, following on from a busy period for Kalos after Lumiose City’s starring return in Pokémon Legends: Z-A.

If you’re looking for details on all the Timed Research Tasks and rewards during Pokémon Go Tour Kalos, Insider Gaming has all the details you need.

Pokémon Go Tour: Kalos Poodle Caboodle Timed Research Tasks & Rewards

The Poodle Cabooble Timed Research during Pokémon Go Tour: Kalos is focused on Furfrou, offering the chance to obtain trims that are not usually available in your region.

While some Furfrou designs are available worldwide, others are locked to a specific region, like the Kabuki Trim in Japan and the Debutante Trim in the Americas.

The tasks are relatively simple, requiring 1km of exploration at each level and changing a Furfrou’s trim, with the rewards being XP boosts. All the details are in the table below.

Pokémon Go Tour: Kalos A Beautiful Day To Celebrate Timed Research Tasks & Rewards

The A Beautiful Day To Celebrate Timed Research Tasks during Pokémon Go Tour: Kalos are based around the three starter Pokémon from the region.

At the beginning of the Timed Research, you are given the choice between Chespin, Fennekin, and Froakie. Over the course of the Timed Research, you can encounter the starter Pokémon that you selected a total of six times.

All of the tasks are the same, no matter which Pokémon you opt for, and they won’t take too much focus to complete, as long as you’re active daily.

The table below shows the tasks, each of which provides a reward of an encounter with the Kalos starter you opted for.

What Kalos starter are you picking for the Pokémon Go Tour Timed Research? Share your choices in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Pokémon, take a look at everything announced on Pokémon Day, and check out what we learned from the first Winds and Waves trailer.

item.title: Should You Choose X or Y in Pokémon Go Tour: Kalos?
item.content:encoded:
Pokémon Go fans have an action-packed weekend ahead with Pokémon Go Tour: Kalos, including an important decision on whether to opt for the X or Y path of Special Research.

The latest Pokémon Go Tour continues the passage through the generations of Pokémon by focusing on the Kalos region, the sixth generation, landing in a period where the region has received a wealth of attention after Lumiose City’s return in Pokémon Legends: Z-A.

If you’re unsure of whether to choose the X or Y path in Pokémon Go, Insider Gaming can help you to decide.

Should You Choose X or Y in Pokémon Go Tour: Kalos

The decision on whether to choose the X or Y path during Pokémon Go Tour: Kalos ultimately comes down to which Legendary Pokémon you want to encounter.

Completing all of the Special Research Tasks from the event provides an encounter with one of the two major Legendary Pokémon of the Kalos region, Xerneas or Yveltal. Both are extremely powerful and handy additions to your squad.

  • More Insider Gaming: All Pokémon Go An X-Ceptional Yarn Special Research Tasks & Rewards

If you have already caught one of the Pokémon, but not the other, the best choice is to opt for the one that is missing from your Pokédex. If you already have both, it might be worth checking the stats to see which is weaker and trying to get a stronger version.

All X & Y Version Reward Differences

Encounters with Xerneas and Yveltal are the headline rewards for completing the Special Research Tasks during Pokémon Go Tour: Kalos, but they’re not the only reward that varies based on your choice.

The rewards are extremely similar, with the main differences being the Pokémon encounters you will earn, including two different forms of Unown.

  • More Insider Gaming: Complete Pokémon Go Tour: Kalos Raid Schedule

Opting for the Y path provides slightly more Stardust and XP, but the difference is minimal. During the Research Tasks, one specific Stardust and XP reward is based on the Pokédex numbers, with Yveltal’s, 717, being one higher than Xerneas at 716.

The table below shows the rewards that are exclusive to the choice you make during Pokémon Go Tour: Kalos.

Are you opting for the X path or Y path during Pokémon Go Tour: Kalos? Share your choice in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Pokémon, take a look at everything announced on Pokémon Day, and check out what we learned from the first Winds and Waves trailer.
